channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Slow Epstein files release not as concerning as docs DOJ has withheld, says Ro Khanna
item.description: Rep. Ro Khanna of California says the Justice Department should've started preparing Epstein files for release months ago. Now, he tells NPR how Congress could intervene to speed up the process.
item.content:encoded:
Rep. Ro Khanna of California says the Justice Department should've started preparing Epstein files for release months ago. Now, he tells NPR how Congress could intervene to speed up the process.

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: In transcript of closed-door testimony, Jack Smith defends his prosecutions of Trump
item.description: The House Oversight Committee has released the transcript and video of a private deposition by former special counsel Jack Smith in December.
item.content:encoded: The House Oversight Committee has released the transcript and video of a private deposition by former special counsel Jack Smith in December.
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: With few Epstein files released, conspiracy theories flourish and questions remain
item.description: President Trump's changing messaging, Congress' unprecedented demands and the Justice Department's piecemeal release of information haven't quieted the questions. Here's what we know — and don't.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's changing messaging, Congress' unprecedented demands and the Justice Department's piecemeal release of information haven't quieted the questions. Here's what we know — and don't.

(Image credit: Staff)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Fire at Swiss resort bar kills 40 people, injures over 100
item.description: About 40 people are dead and more than 100 are injured after a fire ripped through a New Year's Eve party at a Swiss ski resort bar. Authorities are still investigating what caused the blaze.
item.content:encoded: About 40 people are dead and more than 100 are injured after a fire ripped through a New Year's Eve party at a Swiss ski resort bar. Authorities are still investigating what caused the blaze.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Ukrainians remember broken 1994 security promises as it negotiates with Russia
item.description: Ukrainians recall their country giving up nuclear weapons in 1994 in exchange for international security promises that weren't kept. They don't want a repeat in their current negotiations with Russia.
item.content:encoded: Ukrainians recall their country giving up nuclear weapons in 1994 in exchange for international security promises that weren't kept. They don't want a repeat in their current negotiations with Russia.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: AI data centers use a lot of electricity. How it could affect your power bill
item.description: AI data centers require incredible amounts of energy to run. NPR's Planet Money investigates how that demand for power might affect your electric bills.
item.content:encoded: AI data centers require incredible amounts of energy to run. NPR's Planet Money investigates how that demand for power might affect your electric bills.
item.dc:creator: Keith Romer

item.title: In Maine, a new initiative is helping students connect math with the real world
item.description: Federal data shows post-pandemic student math scores are still down. Maine education officials are responding with a new effort to show students that math has real-world relevance.
item.content:encoded: Federal data shows post-pandemic student math scores are still down. Maine education officials are responding with a new effort to show students that math has real-world relevance.
item.dc:creator: Madi Smith

item.title: Discovery helps scientists understand the prehistoric roots of human cremation
item.description: Archaeologists say they've unexpectedly found a huge Stone Age cremation pyre in southern-central Africa. The discovery is helping them understand the history of cremation.
item.content:encoded: Archaeologists say they've unexpectedly found a huge Stone Age cremation pyre in southern-central Africa. The discovery is helping them understand the history of cremation.
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Right-wing influencer's fraud claim leads to threats for Somali daycare owners, DOJ's initial release of Epstein files left many questions unanswered, dozens killed in Swiss Alps bar fire.
item.content:encoded: Right-wing influencer's fraud claim leads to threats for Somali daycare owners, DOJ's initial release of Epstein files left many questions unanswered, dozens killed in Swiss Alps bar fire.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Right-wing influencer's fraud claim leads to threats for Somali day care owners
item.description: A right-wing media influencer accused Somali day care operators in Minnesota of defrauding the federal government. This has led to threats against staff and a federal child care funding freeze.
item.content:encoded: A right-wing media influencer accused Somali day care operators in Minnesota of defrauding the federal government. This has led to threats against staff and a federal child care funding freeze.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann
